jobDescription: Started out navigating traffic for the San Joaquin County Hospital, then I transitioned into a role as an Underwriting Assistant for a company called Golden Bear Insurance, I then worked for San Joaquin County as an election technician, I helped out and filled in as a receptionist for a variety of companies, and then my final position was as an Accounts Payable Assistant for Delta Bluegrass Company.
I worked as a Finance Assistant for the duration of my employment as a volunteer. I learned how to use Microsoft Teams, Microsoft Excel, and even a bit of project management.

I was hired to as an Accounting Assistant and that was my role for the duration of employment for the company. The company used QuickBooks and Microsoft Excel, I assisted with paying bills, receiving payments and putting together financial spreadsheets.

I came back to work for Robert Half and I worked in Accounting for my two assignments, my first assignment was for Fuel Delivery Services which used Sage 500 and I Was in charge of placing orders and check runs, and my second assignment was for Thomas Allen Vineyard and Winery which used QuickBooks I Was in charge of placing orders, paying bills and check runs.
I worked in Accounts Payable and I was in charge of filing papers, placing orders and I learned how to use Sage 500 because the company used this software.

As an executive Assistant there was a lot of tasks I had to complete. I helped this company start up their QuickBooks, I assisted with installing some of the technology and getting contracts with multiple businesses. I assisted with responding to emails, and I was in charge of opening and closing the office everyday.

I am being taught how to use React for front end development. At first I was taught some of the basics of Javascript like setting up variables, for loops, functions, and Object Oriented Programing, then I learned some intermediate concepts such as AJAX (async Javascript and XML), after that I dove into React and learned React Hooks such as useState, useEffect, useRef, React Routing, Context, and now Redux.
